title: Initial ThorLabs Order - Illumination Components
description: First major order placed for illumination path components including beam expanders, mirrors, and kinematic mounts. This marks the official start of the rsLSM v1.1 rebuild project.
details: Order includes: 2x beam expanders, 4x protected silver mirrors, 6x kinematic mounts, laser safety goggles, optical breadboard clamps. All items selected for compatibility with 488nm laser wavelength.

title: Edmund Optics Filter Set Order
description: Ordered emission and excitation filters optimized for voltage imaging with ASAP3b indicator. Includes bandpass filters and dichroic mirrors.
details: 3x bandpass filters (510/42, 525/50, 542/27), 2x dichroic mirrors, filter wheel compatible mounts. All filters specified for maximum transmission at required wavelengths.

title: ThorLabs Shipment Delivered
description: First major component delivery received. All items inspected and verified against order. Ready to begin optical bench assembly.
details: Unboxing revealed all components in perfect condition. Each optic inspected for surface quality and coating integrity. Mounts tested for smooth adjustment and locking mechanisms.

title: Illumination Bench Construction Begins
description: Started assembly of the illumination optical path on the breadboard. Initial laser alignment and beam expansion testing underway.
details: Mounted laser source, beam expander, and first set of steering mirrors. Verified beam profile using beam profiler. Initial power measurements at 92% of specification.

title: McMaster-Carr Hardware Order
description: Ordered mechanical hardware, fasteners, and mounting brackets for optical bench stabilization and component positioning.
details: Stainless steel screws (M6, M4, M3), T-slot nuts, aluminum brackets, vibration damping pads, cable management clips. All metric hardware for compatibility with optical posts.

title: Phase 1 Complete: Illumination Path Aligned
description: Successfully aligned entire illumination path and verified power output. Beam profile meets specifications with 95% uniformity. System ready for integration with imaging path.
details: Final alignment achieved after 28 days of iterative optimization. Power output: 142mW at sample plane (target: 140mW). Beam profile Gaussian with M² < 1.1. Thermal stability verified over 4-hour test.

title: Camera System Order - Phase 2 Begins
description: Major investment in high-speed scientific CMOS cameras for simultaneous multi-view imaging. Two synchronized cameras with 2048x2048 resolution at 100fps.
details: 2x Kiralux CS505MU1 cameras, Camera Link interface cards, synchronization hardware, mounting adapters, SDK licenses. Cameras selected for low read noise and high quantum efficiency in green spectrum.

title: Newport Objective Lenses Order
description: Custom water-dipping objective lenses for lightsheet imaging with long working distance and high NA.
details: 2x 20x/0.95 NA water-dipping objectives, custom AR coating 500-550nm, 2mm working distance. Specified for minimal spherical aberration and high transmission.

title: Edmund Optics Filters Delivered
description: Filter set arrived and immediately tested for transmission specs. All filters meet or exceed specification. Beginning integration into imaging path.
details: Spectrophotometer testing confirmed >95% transmission at design wavelengths. OD6 blocking at laser line. Mounted filters in rotation stage for quick wavelength switching during experiments.

title: Semrock Dichroic Mirror Order
description: High-performance dichroic mirror for critical fluorescence separation. Edge steepness and flatness specifications required for voltage imaging.
details: Di03-R488-t1-25x36 dichroic, ultra-flat λ/10 surface, edge steepness 0.5% transition width. Custom size 25x36mm for space-constrained optical path.

title: Original Dichroic Mirror Degradation Discovered
description: During testing, original dichroic mirror showed unexpected optical degradation with visible coating damage. Likely caused by high power density exposure during alignment.
details: Mirror exhibited 15% reduction in reflection efficiency and visible pitting in coating. Immediately contacted Semrock for expedited replacement. Root cause: excessive laser power during initial alignment without proper attenuation.

title: Replacement Dichroic Delivered (Expedited)
description: Replacement dichroic mirror arrived via expedited shipping. Tested and installed same day. Implemented power limiting protocol to prevent future damage.
details: New mirror tested at multiple power levels up to 200mW. No degradation observed. Added beam attenuator upstream and power monitoring system. Total downtime: 2 days.

title: Camera Systems Delivered and Tested
description: Both high-speed cameras arrived and passed initial testing. Frame synchronization verified at 100fps. Ready for integration into imaging arms.
details: Cameras tested individually and in synchronized mode. Read noise: 1.2e- RMS. Dark current: <0.01e-/pixel/s at -10°C. Synchronization jitter: <50μs. SDK integration successful.

title: Imaging Path Alignment Optimization
description: Discovered that slight tilt of detection objective improves field flatness by 30%. This unexpected optimization significantly enhances image quality at field edges.
details: Through systematic testing, found that 2.3° tilt angle compensates for field curvature. Edge resolution improved from 3.5μm to 2.4μm. Will incorporate this finding into final alignment protocol.

title: Phase 2 Complete: Imaging Path Operational
description: Full imaging path aligned and characterized. Both camera views synchronized with <10μm co-registration error. System achieves 2.1μm lateral resolution across 800μm field of view.
details: Completed 35-day imaging path build. Final specs: 2.1μm XY resolution, 4μm Z resolution, 800x600μm FOV, 100fps dual-view acquisition. PSF measurements confirm diffraction-limited performance.

title: DigiKey Electronics Components Order - Phase 3 Begins
description: Massive order of electronic components for control system: microcontrollers, power supplies, DAC/ADC boards, connectors, and passive components.
details: Arduino Due, Teensy 4.1, 16-bit DACs (x4), ADCs, voltage regulators, MOSFETs, capacitors, resistors, terminal blocks, ribbon cables. All components selected for 5V/3.3V logic compatibility.

title: National Instruments DAQ System Order
description: High-speed data acquisition system for camera triggering, galvo control, and sensor monitoring. USB-6363 with 2MS/s sampling.
details: NI USB-6363 DAQ, BNC-2110 connector block, SHC68-68-EPM cable. 32 analog inputs, 4 analog outputs, 48 digital I/O. LabVIEW driver license included.

title: Timing Circuit Optimization Discovery
description: Unexpected breakthrough: Optimized timing circuits achieve 2x faster scanning speed than projected. System now capable of 200fps instead of planned 100fps.
details: By implementing hardware-based trigger generation instead of software timing, reduced jitter from 500μs to 25μs. This enables stable operation at 200fps. Opens possibilities for real-time neural activity tracking.

title: Control Electronics Assembly Complete
description: All electronic control systems assembled, wired, and tested. Power distribution verified, signal routing confirmed, and fail-safes operational.
details: Completed custom PCB assembly, wired 8 subsystems, installed in 19-inch rack mount. All voltage rails stable within 1% tolerance. Emergency shutdown circuit tested and functional.

title: DAQ Card Integration and Testing Complete
description: Successfully integrated National Instruments DAQ system with all subsystems. Camera triggering, galvo control, and sensor monitoring all operational.
details: Programmed DAQ for simultaneous camera triggering, galvo waveform generation, and temperature/vibration monitoring. Verified <10μs synchronization across all channels. LabVIEW test suite passing.

title: Power Supply Overheating Challenge
description: Main 12V power supply overheating during extended operation. Thermal shutdown triggered after 90 minutes at full load.
details: Supply rated for 10A continuous, but actual draw peaks at 11.2A during camera acquisition. Ordered higher capacity 15A supply and added forced air cooling to existing unit as temporary solution.

title: Phase 3 Complete: All Hardware Integration Done
description: Completed integration of all optical, mechanical, and electronic systems. Full microscope hardware operational and ready for software control implementation.
details: 25-day electronics phase complete. All subsystems communicating, safety interlocks functional, thermal management stable. System ready for software development and testing.

title: Software Development Environment Setup - Phase 4 Begins
description: Initialized software repositories, configured development environment, and established testing framework. Ready to begin acquisition software development.
details: Set up Python 3.11 environment, installed NumPy/SciPy/PyQt6, configured camera SDKs, established Git workflow. Created test suite structure and CI pipeline.

title: Real-Time Image Processing Pipeline Implemented
description: Developed GPU-accelerated image processing pipeline achieving real-time registration and motion correction at 100fps. Exceeds performance targets.
details: Implemented CUDA-based processing using CuPy. Pipeline performs flat-field correction, registration, and drift compensation in <8ms per frame pair. Enables closed-loop feedback during experiments.

title: Acquisition Software Testing Complete
description: Core acquisition software passed all unit tests and integration tests. GUI functional, file I/O verified, and multi-hour stability testing successful.
details: Software successfully controlled all hardware subsystems, acquired synchronized dual-view data, and saved to HDF5 format. 12-hour stress test completed without errors or memory leaks.

title: First Test Acquisition - Fluorescent Beads
description: Achieved first successful test acquisition using fluorescent microspheres. System performance validated end-to-end with real optical signal.
details: Imaged 2μm fluorescent beads in agarose gel. Confirmed 2.1μm lateral resolution, proper dual-view registration, and stable acquisition over 10,000 frames. Signal-to-noise ratio: 42:1.

title: Zebrafish Mounting Protocol Optimization
description: Developed improved zebrafish mounting protocol reducing motion artifacts by 60%. Uses custom 3D-printed chamber with optimized agarose concentration.
details: Tested agarose concentrations from 0.5% to 2%. Found 1.2% low-melting point agarose optimal for immobilization while maintaining animal health. Custom chamber design reduces meniscus effects.

title: First Live Zebrafish Imaging Success
description: Historic milestone: Successfully imaged voltage dynamics across entire zebrafish brain for first time with rsLSM v1.1. System performing beyond specifications.
details: Acquired 30-minute recording of spontaneous neural activity in 6dpf larva expressing ASAP3b. Captured 180,000 dual-view frames with full brain coverage. Signal quality excellent, fish healthy post-imaging.

title: Phase 4 Complete: System Fully Operational
description: rsLSM v1.1 rebuild complete. All systems operational and validated. Ready for consciousness research experiments. 4.5-month build completed successfully.
details: Final system specifications achieved or exceeded on all metrics. Total build time: 135 days. Ready to begin groundbreaking experiments observing consciousness across entire vertebrate brain.

title: Spach Optics Custom Lightsheet Cylinder Lens
description: Custom cylindrical lens for lightsheet generation with precise thickness control. Designed for ultra-thin 3μm lightsheet waist.
details: Custom ground and polished cylindrical lens, focal length 50mm, AR coating 480-520nm. Specified for <λ/4 surface accuracy to achieve desired lightsheet profile.
